title: Riven vs Fiora
body:
What are their differences? Which is the better tryhard 1v9 carry faker pro korean op top lane solo que god tier mastery seven toxic champion?

Discuss!

replies.body:
Riven: 

Has a shield, and is generic in every way, a lot of mobility and high burst melee AD champion.

Fiora: 

has AOE heal in ult and on every vital hit, true damage, same genericy, alot of mobility and sustained damage.

Error 404 bias not found.

Looks like there is something wrong with your post, maybe try being more one sided.
Riven is feast or famine (MUST get fed early or useless) and Fiora is feast or feast (shes innately a late game champion so feeding early doesn't matter)
but to answer your question Riven is less mechanically intensive so Riven you can try-hard harder.
Fiora is less mechanically intensive*

your opinion matters; until fact comes into play

Fiora: https://gyazo.com/e84d2af1265317ae78231bddf63c8a7a

Riven: https://gyazo.com/e40ded2c9402cedf8e3431b01136b9fa

I would love for you to post your first riven game experience vs your first fiora game experience and tell me how it goes. From personal experience fiora is infinitely less mechanically intensive in every way shape and form due to her not actually having combos to perform or micro decision making. while the enemy can just walk away from fiora to move the vitals... the same goes for fiora her q always gain cd reduction as long as it hits something while rivens does not. you see where im going with this? rivens mobility and dmg is always gonna revolve around moderate length cd while fioras dmg and mobility kindve dont. tldr riven and fiora might have similar seeming strats and fighting styles in truth they only begin to unite towards late game. early game rivens cds are so long that she really has to choose her battles... unless they are gp just always all in a gp... fiora gets a free poke every couple of seconds depending on actions taking truly. wow i need to put more periods in there.
I dunno, I think Riven is more easy to me

>From personal experience

I'm not speaking subjectively, I'm speaking objectively.

 You are opinionated, I am not.

 I speak from fact, you are not.

Incorrect. You have personal bias. You have a small sample size. There is no way to have a perfect comparison between the two champions because you played against different players and different champions. You also did not take into account who has the lower skill floor, but higher skill ceiling, but you just assumed Riven was easier. 

Try and act like a smartass a little more, I would love to hand your ass to you.

>act like a smartass

it is not acting I am a "smartass".
I am simply grateful that I am not a 'dumbass' as you are, I speak from fact you do not, I am correct, you are not.

I've already posted my proof and it is flawless evidence, the only time I am wrong is if I choose to not be right.

>I would love to hand your ass to you

LOLOLOLOL please.. please whatever you do, don't kill yourself.

Yeah you are. You act as if no one can prove your point otherwise, especially when it's wrong. You think that you have your "flawless" argument and no one can say otherwise. 

And guess what, Riot isn't usually right about their champions and that's why their balance is pretty bad. They didn't even know what was the best stat for reworked Gangplank. "if I choose not to be right" talk about how you're not a smartass. Go talk some more. lul

Get your ass handed back to you again. You probably don't even know how to do a Riven fast combo. I doubt you even know what it is.
didn't bother reading, sorry not sorry, just clearing my unread message updates, you entertained me enough, thanks again by the way.
Like you get messages from people on the boards, do you? Go, keep on trying to act like a smartass, because I will keep on handing your ass to you.
Not to mention he simply listed Riot's "difficulty" curve for champions. All Riot is stating is how easy their base skills are to use, not the amount of skill actually required to play them.
"Got'em"
lul. I didn't even see what he linked. I just assumed that the guy was a salty idiot.
He linked Fiora's then Riven's stats from the updated clients. (Fiona had 3 bars on her difficulty scale while Riven had 2)

Alright if fact dictates that yasuo is one of the hardest in the game but almost the entire community unanimously agrees that he isn't. who is right? the people who claim yasuo isn't one the most difficult champions to play or the people who say he is mlg status?

you can't pick up yasuo is one day and do amazing with, however you can get fed with riven facerolling the whole game, ability cancelling or anything like that has nothing to do with my perfect facts, you don't need aa cancels or ability cancels to faceroll with riven.

Just because u can face roll doesn't mean its a gg ez win. the only person riven can faceroll in lane and have a chance of even beating is a gp and thats because his laning is trash tier. riven in anything above silver has a hard time without champ mechanics. mainly because everybody and their mother knows riven without her combos or aa cancels is weaker than just about every other top laner that isnt gp. if u wanna talk of a real face-roller  then talk about jayce.
*DUN DUN DUUUUUUUUN* {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-rainbows}}
As a Riven player, I am bias. So Riven. She has more total options and is far more bullshit than Fiora except in a tank meta.

rivens.

when they're on my team, they suck. when they're on the enemy team, i never know because I always dodge.
feelsbadman
Dragon... Man... Squid...
Flying Spaghetti Monster says hi.
all hail his noodly appendages
Koro-sensei? is that you?
they are pretty much the same thing, when shklees grouchy shklee becomes cthulu
Aquaman33?

Riven has theoretically infinite potential with her skill ceiling

Fiora is indeed *the best* duelist currently known if played to Perfection

Riven is more bs than Fiora:

Riven has: no mana/energy/HP cost on abilities, high damage, dash, stun, shield, auto attack damage booster (ult), burst ranged ult, can play a fairly good semi-tank, and has knock up.

EDIT: oh yeah, and low cooldown on all abilities.

PFFFFT

We all know Faker plays Xin top to 1v9 carry.
Riven has to tryhard harder to do well. More complex mechanics and combos.  Fiora you don't really have to try at all.
Who is more tryhard between riven and fiora? Why not both are equally tryhard. I mean... I guess riven has a larger need to crush lane or be useless...
I'd argue Riven, but Fiora is the better champion overall.
You forgot to put the option of all hail our lord & savior Teemo.
You misspelled satan.
